title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<ansuz> has quit  
07:45 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki

09:33 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki

09:55 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
10:09 <acotiuga> has quit  
10:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:25 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <Denis> has quit  
10:34 <pascal\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <pascal\_\_> hi  
10:34 <pascal\_\_> can i export all the wiki pages as doc at once ?  
10:34 <pascal\_\_> i tried , and it export a single page  
10:35 <pascal\_\_> and if i only change teh export format to use html , it works  
10:35 <pascal\_\_> could it be that is missed soemthing ?  
10:38 <tmortagne> pascal\_\_: the export you have in the page action is for the current page  
10:38 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
10:38 <tmortagne> same thing for html so I don't see how you can end up with the whole wiki  
10:38 <tmortagne> if you want an export of the whole wiki as XAR you should g to the wiki administration  
10:39 <pascal\_\_> thats   easy to get  
10:39 <pascal\_\_> but it  snot what i want  
10:39 <tmortagne> what you want is not very clear then :)  
10:40 <tmortagne> what do you want exactly ?  
10:40 <pascal\_\_> export all wiki pages as .doc  
10:40 <pascal\_\_> ort multiple.doc , one per page  
10:40 <tmortagne> the whole wiki in a word file ?  
10:40 <pascal\_\_> multiples, liek it does for the html export  
10:41 <pascal\_\_> html export  make a zip with many html files insides , one per page  
10:41 <tmortagne> maybe http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Multipage+Export+Application then  
10:41 <tmortagne> hmm no it does not seems to support .doc  
10:42 <tmortagne> only pdf  
10:42 <pascal\_\_> :/  
10:44 <tmortagne> it should not be too hard to do what you want in a script  
10:44 <tmortagne> it's about listing all the pages in the wiki and for each page use the standard export API to put them in a zip or export them in some folder in the server  
10:54 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:55 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <Evi\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <Evi\_> Hi, I've renamed the "blog page" and now it doesn't look like a blog anymore. Now it looks like "normal wiki pages". Can you help me, pls?  
10:57 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <Evi\_> Can someone help me? I've renamed the blog space and it doesn't look like blog anymore now.  
11:32 <moep> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <Evi\_> has quit  
11:42 <Evi> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:55 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:55 <M-cescobarresi> has joined #xwiki  
12:57 <M-cescobarresi> has left #xwiki  
12:57 <Evi> I have problems with the blog app. Would you reccomend to deinstall it and reinstall it again? I have renamed it an know it does not work properly anymore.  
13:10 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <evalica> Evi - you could try that - if you are an advanced user, you could check to see if the appropiate objects are set on those pages  
13:11 <evalica> that you said are now normal pages: you can check for BlogClass, BlogPostClass objects ....  
13:12 <Evi> how can I check if the appropiate objecte are set on those pages?  
13:12 <evalica> in /bin/edit/ mode …. when you edit a page, you have at the end of the URL ?editor=wysiwyg  
13:13 <evalica> or ?editor=wiki  
13:13 <evalica> replace this with: ?editor=object  
13:13 <evalica> and see what objects you have set there - you should compare a normal blog post, with the one with problems  
13:14 <evalica> and see if something is missing - but to be honest I'm not sure what you did or what the problem is  
13:14 <evalica> this is just a way to verify the objects are there  
13:14 <evalica> It might be a bit hard :) so you should try reinstalling the app | try to rename the blog post back :) I don't know - there are multiple variants  
13:17 <Evi> when I add objects, there title, content is empty - is that normal?  
13:18 <Evi> I guess I cannot fix it and have to deinstall the whole wiki  
13:23 <ClemensR> yes, it is normal that contents of objects are initially empty. Blog posts should have content in the already existing objects, however.  
13:24 <ClemensR> ah, you renamed the complete blog app. I am afraid that this does not work. You can try to rename the app back (i.e. the start page) and then things should go back to normal  
13:32 <evalica> Evi: if you cannot uninstall, than you should reimport it. You should go to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Blog+Application , click on Download, go to Administration - Import, and reimport the XAR file.  
13:32 <evalica> actually, you need to reimport the version of your wiki.  
13:33 <evalica> see what version you have and replace 8.1 with your version in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/repository/extensions/org.xwiki.platform%3Axwiki-platform-blog-ui/versions/8.1/file?rid=maven-xwiki  
13:35 <Evi> alright, thx, I'll try - to rename it back does not work out, cause a error appears 'A document with the name (Blog.WebHome) exists already. Pls give another name'  
13:37 <evalica> and if you go to Blog.WebHome what do you see?  
13:39 <Evi> then comes the blog page, but it looks like normal wiki-page and not like a blog page. when I add a page to the blog I can only create "normal wiki pages"  
13:39 <evalica> maybe on the Blog.WebHome you have a redirect object (the page was not deleted, but was added a redirect to the new location). You can manually delete Blog.WebHome or edit the redirect object.  
13:40 <evalica> To be honest I am not sure what you describing ….  
13:40 <evalica> if you don't have the Blog.WebHome it's normal that when you press Add, you create normal pages. You can create Blog post only from the WebHome you just deleted  
13:41 <Evi> ok  
13:43 <Evi> So i try to delete Blog.WebHome  
13:43 <ClemensR> oh, wait  
13:44 <Evi> ok I wait  
13:44 <ClemensR> you get a redirect from Blog.WebHome to the page in the new location, automatically  
13:44 <ClemensR> if you try to go to Blog.WebHome  
13:44 <ClemensR> that is the blog home page in its new location, we do not want to trow away that one  
13:45 <Enygma`> Evi: did you rename with children or just the Blog homepage?  
13:45 <Evi> with children  
13:46 <ClemensR> hm, wow, I just tried locally, and there are now a log of rediects  
13:46 <Enygma`> and with automatic redirect, right?  
13:46 <ClemensR> one can delete them one by one, but that is very combersome  
13:47 <ClemensR> one can see them in the "Page Index", and in theory delete from there  
13:48 <Enygma`> Evi: go to the following url http://yourDomain:port/xwiki/bin/delete/Blog/  
13:48 <Enygma`> check "Affect children"  
13:48 <ClemensR> ah, no, one can delete the blog home page directly hand things are ok  
13:48 <Enygma`> and click delete  
13:48 <ClemensR> yes, Enygma` has the right link. I just tired and that works :)  
13:48 <Enygma`> this will delete the old Blog location that is now full of redirects  
13:49 <Enygma`> Next, go to your renamed blog location and do a rename (with children but do not include automatic redirects) to the old location "Blog"  
13:50 <Evi> Manage blogs on this wiki does not work, there are vilocity errors  
13:51 <Enygma`> tried it locally and I also got "The execution of the [velocity] script macro is not allowed."  
13:52 <ClemensR> yes, here too, oen need to edit a few pages, which suddenly are created by the "anonymous user"  
13:53 <ClemensR> Blog/Archive  and Blog/BlogCode  
13:53 <Evi> what do I have to do extactly?  
13:53 <ClemensR> hm, and Blog/BlogTemplate  ... this list gets longer :-/  
13:53 <Enygma`> those pages need to be fixed to have the proper content author  
13:54 <ClemensR> I wonder if uninstall and reinstall might be quicker at this moment  
13:55 <ClemensR> nah, does not work, extension manager wants me to uninstall the complete UI, of course :p  
13:55 <evalica> reimport it from e.x.o - using the Download XAR  
13:55 <Enygma`> xar import would be perfect now  
13:55 <Enygma`> Evi: what version of XWiki do you have?  
13:55 <Evi>  7.4.2  
13:56 <Enygma`> download this xar file locally on your computer http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/repository/extensions/org.xwiki.platform%3Axwiki-platform-blog-ui/versions/7.4.2/file?rid=maven-xwiki  
13:56 <Enygma`> then go to your wiki in Administration > Content > Import  
13:57 <Enygma`> and upload the xar file from your machine (that you have just downloaded)  
13:57 <Enygma`> when upload is complete it will be listed in the "Available packages"  
13:57 <Evi> ok, thank you. I'll try  
13:57 <Enygma`> when it`s available, select it, and then click Import  
13:58 <Enygma`> when the import is complete, your blog should be working fine  
13:58 <Enygma`> let us know if it doesn`t  
13:59 <Enygma`> Evi: you could also check "import as backup" before pressing "Import", just to be sure  
13:59 <Evi> there are several options: 1. add this version to exisiting 2. replace existing with the new one 3. set history back to 1.1  
13:59 <Enygma`> (that option sets XWiki.Admin as the author of theose files)  
14:00 <Enygma`> leave the default (Add a new version to the existing page)  
14:00 <Evi> ok  
14:00 <Enygma`> so you will have the history intact  
14:00 <Evi> and I set a check in the the backup field  
14:01 <Enygma`> yes, to make it have the same users as when it`s a clean wiki installation  
14:01 <Enygma`> (user set as author)  
14:01 <Enygma`> then click import  
14:02 <Evi> it is there  
14:02 <Evi> OMG - I am so happy ! Made my DAY  
14:02 <Enygma`> happy everything is ok  
14:03 <Enygma`> sorry for the problem, we`ll create an issue since that is definitely a bug at least in the rename operation (the second time we used it to fix the blog)  
14:03 <Enygma`> as a general note, try to avoid renaming applications since they will not work anymore  
14:04 <Enygma`> renaming data (or application entries - like a blog post, etc) is fine most of the time, but renaming the application's code or homepage usually leads to bad results :)  
14:05 <Evi> ok, there are now 2 blogs..So I'm wondering what to do now..I just need one  
14:05 <Enygma`> what do you mean by 2 blogs?  
14:05 <Enygma`> how did you deduce that?  
14:06 <Evi> I don't know, but there are two now - and under the logo 2 big "blog" buttons  
14:07 <ClemensR> this does not go away when you reload the page ?  
14:07 <Enygma`> ah, in the app bar you mean on, the left  
14:07 <Evi> yes  
14:07 <ClemensR> do both icons link to the same page ?  
14:07 <Enygma`> clicking on them takes you to different pages or is it the same page?  
14:08 <Evi> they link to the same page  
14:08 <Enygma`> is restarting you wiki an option?  
14:09 <Enygma`> that might fix it since the import probably re-registered the AppBar entry for the blog  
14:09 <Evi> yes, I see  
14:09 <Enygma`> so it`s the same blog link, just listed twice  
14:09 <Evi> can I delete one "blog" somehow?  
14:10 <Enygma`> restarting XWiki should delete the extra "blog" entry  
14:10 <Evi> xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Management works now  
14:17 <Evi> I just delteted one blog with its children. Now, everything looks fine. One blog - just like I started today bevore renaming it (which was a fault!)! So thank you very very much, Enygma and ClemensR for your help! I'm very thankfull. Maybe you could make a hint for everybody. Maybe I am not the only one with this problem. Thank you!  
14:19 <ClemensR> ok, glad to hera that it works. As Enygma` said, that renaming things back did not repair everything is definitely a bug and should not happened  
14:24 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:24 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <acotiuga> has quit  
14:54 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:54 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <Evi> Hello, it's me again. ^^ I have a short question concerning http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/RecentBlogEntriesMacro. I've installed it and I like it a lot. But is it normal that a page in the wiki appears named 'code' containing another page named 'http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/RecentBlogEntriesMacro'. Of course I don't want that this is seen by every user. So I can hide the parent page. But is this "normal"? I think it i  
15:15 <Enygma`> mflorea: Just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13492 based on the recent discussion on IRC.  
15:17 <Enygma`> Evi: not very clear what you are describing. What page in the wiki, where do you see that?  
15:18 <Enygma`> ClemensR: created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13492 for the rename issue.  
15:18 <ClemensR> thanks :)  
15:18 <mflorea> Enygma`: dup of XWIKI-13401  
15:19 <Evi> It is not really a problem. I can hide the page. A page named 'code' appeared in the wiki unter 'pages'. This page containes the RecentBlogEntriesMacro, which I've just installed.  
15:22 <mflorea> Enygma`, ClemensR check the "Backlinks and PR" thread on the security mailing list  
15:25 <Enygma`> mflorea: so the problem appears only on pages that contain links to the currently renamed page  
15:25 <Enygma`> why not just update the links in those pages and save them with the previous author/contentAuthor?  
15:25 <mflorea> yes, or its child pages (when child pages are included in rename)  
15:26 <Enygma`> because we would generate a change in the history for a user that did not really do the change?  
15:26 <mflorea> again, check the thread, what you propose is a solution, but it's not right for user X to see that he modified some page when he didn't  
15:26 <msmeria> has quit  
15:26 <mflorea> yep  
15:27 <Enygma`> Evi: I remember what you mean. That macro is located in a badly chosen location. The best option for you right now is to simply hide that "code" page.  
15:28 <Evi> alright, thx Enygma. I just wondered, if this is normal or if I've made a mistake. But then, it's perfectly fine. I think this macro is usefull.  
15:44 <Enygma`> mflorea: answered on the mail. Thanks for reminding me about it.  
15:59 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <Evi> Is it possible to replace the message stream on the main-homepage with the recentblogentries?  
16:08 <ClemensR> yes, if you edit the dashboard. I am no sure how the layout will look like, however  
16:17 <Evi> ok, thx for the hint. It worked :)  
16:33 <Evi> has quit

23:36 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
23:49 <sputnikkcylon> has joined #xwiki  
23:51 <sputnikkcylon> On Main.WebHome I page Rights: Page set to XWikiAllGroup View only. Comment,edit,script,delete are explicitly denied. Yet, new ldapusers are able to add pages on it. What gives?  
23:59 <sputnikkcylon> wait a second. i don't see a method for denying creation rights?!
